Package org.unidue.campusfm.queerzard.cms.web.controllers.rest.api.v1.article

Class ArticlesController

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.unidue.campusfm.queerzard.cms.web.controllers.rest.api.v1.article.ArticlesController
  • @RestController
@RequestMapping("/api/v1/article")
public class ArticlesController
extends java.lang.Object
    The ArticlesController class provides RESTful API endpoints for managing articles. These endpoints allow users to access, create, update, and delete articles. The endpoints also handle authorization logic to ensure that only authorized users can perform certain actions. This class is annotated with the @RestController and @RequestMapping annotations to define the base URL for all article-related requests.

    • Method Detail

      • handleGetMapping

        @GetMapping
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.Object> handleGetMapping​(org.springframework.security.core.Authentication authentication,
                                                                                  @RequestParam("article")
                                                                                  java.lang.String articleId)
        Obtain an article by its ID. If article.published is false and the user is not the author or an admin, access is refused. If the user is the author or an admin, access is granted. If article.published is true, access is granted.
        Parameters:
        authentication - the authentication object containing the user details
        articleId - the ID of the article to obtain
        Returns:
        a ResponseEntity object with the article details if access is granted, or an error message if access is refused

      • handlePostMapping

        @PostMapping
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.Object> handlePostMapping​(org.springframework.security.core.Authentication authentication,
                                                                                   @RequestParam(value="article",required=false)
                                                                                   java.lang.String articleId,
                                                                                   @RequestParam(value="pub",required=false)
                                                                                   boolean publishBool)
        Generate a database entry for a new article. If authenticated, create the article. If not authenticated, refuse the creation of the article.
        Parameters:
        authentication - the authentication object containing the user details
        articleId - the ID of the article to modify (optional)
        publishBool - the publication status of the article (optional)
        Returns:
        a ResponseEntity object with the modified article details if successful, or an error message if access is refused or if the article does not exist

      • handlePutMapping

        @PutMapping
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.Object> handlePutMapping​(org.springframework.security.core.Authentication authentication,
                                                                                  @RequestParam("article")
                                                                                  java.lang.String articleId,
                                                                                  ArticleModel articleModel)
        Replace the content of an existing article. If the user is the author or an administrator, the article will be deleted and replaced. If the user is neither the author nor an administrator, the replacement will be refused.
        Parameters:
        authentication - the authentication object containing the user details
        articleId - the ID of the article to replace
        articleModel - the new article content
        Returns:
        a ResponseEntity object with the modified article details if successful, or an error message if access is refused or if the article does not exist

      • handlePatchMapping

        @PatchMapping
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.Object> handlePatchMapping​(org.springframework.security.core.Authentication authentication,
                                                                                    @RequestParam("article")
                                                                                    java.lang.String articleId,
                                                                                    @RequestPart(value="title",required=false)
                                                                                    java.lang.String title,
                                                                                    @RequestPart(value="content",required=false)
                                                                                    java.lang.String content,
                                                                                    @RequestPart(value="tags",required=false)
                                                                                    java.lang.String tags,
                                                                                    @RequestPart("category")
                                                                                    java.lang.String category,
                                                                                    @RequestPart(value="previewImage",required=false)
                                                                                    org.springframework.web.multipart.MultipartFile multipartFile)
        Patch the content of an existing article. If the user is the author or an administrator, the specified fields of the article will be updated. If the user is neither the author nor an administrator, the patching will be refused.
        Parameters:
        authentication - the authentication object containing the user details
        articleId - the ID of the article to patch
        title - the new title of the article (optional)
        content - the new content of the article (optional)
        tags - the new tags of the article (optional)
        category - the new category of the article
        multipartFile - the new preview image of the article (optional)
        Returns:
        a ResponseEntity object with the modified article details if successful, or an error message if access is refused or if the article does not exist
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is an error reading the multipart file

      • handleDeleteMapping

        @DeleteMapping
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.Object> handleDeleteMapping​(org.springframework.security.core.Authentication authentication,
                                                                                     @RequestParam("article")
                                                                                     java.lang.String articleId)
        Delete an article entry from the database. If the user is the author or an administrator, the article will be deleted. If the user is neither the author nor an administrator, the deletion will be refused.
        Parameters:
        authentication - the authentication object containing the user details
        articleId - the ID of the article to delete
        Returns:
        a ResponseEntity object with a success message if the article is deleted successfully, or an error message if access is refused or if the article does not exist
